Blogs

Introducing the School of Quant

In India alone, algorithmic trading as a percentage of overall turnover has gone from 9.26% to 49.8% from 2010 to 2018, according to this report by Financial Express. As a quant, trying to maneuver your way around the markets can be daunting with so much competition. However, that doesn’t mean that all hope is lost.
Ultimately, quants still rule the markets, whether it’s Wall Street or Dalal Street. This is why we are launching the School of Quant, an initiative to help promote quantitative trading for the modern trader.

What is the School of Quant?

It is a bold attempt to bring together like-minded quants from around the world. Ultimately, there are no limits in quantitative trading, because anything can move the stock markets. The trick is: how efficiently are you able to quantify the trading decision?
Here’s a video we put together which provides an overview of the initiative.

We are starting with a course on AI-Powered Algorithmic Trading. This is a 8 lesson, month long course (commences the first week of February) and covers the following topics

A PRIMER ON ALGORITHMIC TRADING
QUANTITATIVE TRADING TECHNIQUES
A BETTER WAY TO UNDERSTAND RISK AND REWARD
AN INTRADAY TRADING SYSTEM
ALL ABOUT BACK-TESTING
AN OPTION TRADING SYSTEM
AI, NLP, MACHINE LEARNING IN THE QUANT WORLD
A LONG TERM HOLDING STRATEGY

 Each lesson is taught by Raghu Kumar and Aseem Singhal, is 60 minutes in duration, and is taught over a live webinar.

What’s the Goal?

There are many reasons for why we are doing this. Here are two.

Reason #1 Identifying New Quants
As a fund management company, Rain Technologies is aware of its limitations, namely that any algorithm we use today may fail tomorrow. We are always on the lookout for new trading strategies. To us, this is the best way to promote an organic community of quants who may be willing to work with us in the future.

Reason #2 Growing The Quant Community
Our long term goal with the School of Quant is to become a one-stop destination for learning how to build quantitative trading and investing strategies. In order to do this, we will soon be launching an interactive blog, a podcast wherein we interview expert quantitative traders and fund managers, and an online forum where quants may exchange ideas.
